result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob A Singer was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Do not drive or operate motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Counts 4 and 5 were both dismissed outright.

Restitution hearing to be held on 5/06/2016 at 9:30 AM.
Remaining bail to be held in trust until then.

AS OF 5/6/16: Restitution of $333,987.33 was added. $317,469.94 to Rural Insurance Company and $16,517.39 to the victim. Victim to be paid first.
25% of defendant's prison wages ONLY to be paid to the restitution. To be also paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision, along with all surcharges.
BAIL OF $2,711.20 WAS APPLIED TO THE RESTITUTION. (Goes to Victim first)

If Defendant is discharged/revoked Civil Judgment to be entered.

records.addlTxt: 6/12/17 Letter from Defendant regarding sentence credit

The Court has reviewed the Defendant's pro se letter.  The restitution figure was set as a result of a hearing that the Defendant participated in.  The additional sentence credit has now been reflected on an amended Judgment of Conviction.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob A Singer
Current: PO Box 351, c/o Waupun Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 05-02-2017)
Prior: N82W23522 Pitching Wedge Ct., Sussex, WI 53089 United States
Letter from Defendant received 5/2/17 regarding sentence credit and court costs

Defendant Jacob A Singer in court, in custody, with attorney Robert Buckett.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for restitution hearing. Parties stipulate to the the amounts owed, but the defense does argue as to how the defendant can pay the amound that is owed. State presents arguments. Court does award the restitution amount of $317,469.94 to Rural Mutual Insurance and $16,517.39 to the victim and the victim is to be paid 1st. Apply the remaining bail towards the restitution that is owed to the victim.  Court further orders that 25% of defendant's prison wages only are to be paid towards the restitution amounts. Defendant is further ordered 31 more days of credit toward his sentence.   Defendant can be returned forthwith.
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional Inst.
Copy of letter from DA to Rural Mutual Insurance
Restitution hearing at 05-06-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Jacob A Singer in court, in custody, with attorney Robert Buckett.   Jayne Dewire Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

 5 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 128 days)
  -  2 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 
Sentence to run consecutive

*D/L REVOCATION: 2 years.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 2 years.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment  
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to the Village of  Menmonee Falls Police Department);

RESTITUTION:  To be determined 

DNA Surcharge  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);
COURT COSTS: $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 03:00 pm
